com.amazon.device.ads

Interface Ad

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdLayout, InterstitialAd, ModelessInterstitialAd

    public interface Ad
    An interface for views used to retrieve and display Amazon ads. Ad views can only load and display one ad at a time, although there is no limitation on the number of Ads you can instantiate.

    Making ad requests to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network requires the INTERNET permission. Additionally we recommend that you include permissions for FINE_LOCATION, COURSE_LOCATION, NETWORK_STATE, and WIFI_STATE. These additional permissions allow Amazon to provide contextual and geo-targeted ads to your users, which may result in higher CPMs. Declare these permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • setListener

        void setListener(AdListener adListener)
        Sets the listener used to track ad life-cycle events. Only one listener can be assigned per Ad instance. Calling setListener a second time would overwrite the existing listener with the new listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - An instance of AdListener that will be notified during ad life-cycle changes.

      • loadAd

        boolean loadAd(AdTargetingOptions adTargetingOptions)
        Creates a background thread to load a new ad based on AdTargetingOptions. When the ad loads successfully AdListener.onAdLoaded(Ad, AdProperties) is called. When the ad fails to load the AdListener.onAdFailedToLoad(Ad, AdError) is called. An ad that is currently loaded will only be cleared if the new loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call completes successfully.

        Only one ad can be loading at a time. The loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call will return true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress.

        Making ad requests to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network requires the INTERNET permission. Additionally we recommend that you include permissions for FINE_LOCATION, COURSE_LOCATION, NETWORK_STATE, and WIFI_STATE. These additional permissions allow Amazon to provide contextual and geo-targeted ads to your users, which may result in higher CPMs. Declare these permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml.
        Parameters:
        adTargetingOptions - Additional ad options. Use this parameter to set targeting settings
        Returns:
        Returns true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and returns false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress or because the current ad is expanded.

      • loadAd

        boolean loadAd()
        Creates a background thread to load a new ad.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and returns false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress or because the current ad is expanded.
        See Also:
        com.amazon.device.ads.Ad#loadAd(AdTargetingOptions)}

      • isLoading

        boolean isLoading()
        Gets whether this Ad is currently being loaded. Only one ad can be loading at a time. Use this method to check if a new loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call can be made.
        Returns:
        Returns true if an ad is currently being loaded, and false if there is no ad being loaded.

      • getTimeout

        int getTimeout()
        Gets the current timeout value in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The current timeout value in milliseconds.

      • setTimeout

        void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the timeout value for loading the ad. Loading starts when loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) is called. The default value is 20000 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
